action.action-desc: Mr. Torres of New York (for himself and Mr. Garbarino) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and Workforce

form.official-title: To amend the Higher Education Act of 1965 to prohibit institutions of higher education from receiving gifts from certain countries, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the No Foreign Gifts Act of 2025.

section.header: Prohibition on gifts from certain countries
section.text: The Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1001 et seq.) is amended by inserting after section 117 the following:

section.header: Prohibition on gifts from certain countries

subsection.text: Beginning on the date of the enactment of this section, an institution of higher education that receives funds under this Act may not receive a gift fromâ€”

paragraph.text: a country that, as of such date of enactment, has provided material support to a foreign terrorist organization, as determined by the Secretary of State; or
China, Russia, North Korea, or Iran.

subsection.text: In order to continue to be eligible to receive funds under this Act, an institution described in subsection (a) must, for each instance where such institution is offered a gift from a country described in such subsection, report such offer to the Secretary.

paragraph.text: The term material support has the meaning given the term material support and resources in section 2339A(b) of title 18, United States Code.
The term foreign terrorist organization means an entity designated by the Secretary of State under section 219 of the Immigration and Nationality Act (8 U.S.C. 1189).
